Reviews.Title: HD Movies and Terrific Pictures Without Breaking the Bank
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I purchased this camera solely for the HD recording feature.  It's a bonus in that it takes pretty darn good pictures, too.  I trust the Fuji name and I should have known this camera would deliver on both counts.  My first digital camera was a Fuji A205, and even today it takes quality photos as good as it did almost 7 years ago.Pictures are sharp and the colors are right on target.  Response time after taking a picture without using the flash was just about 1 second or even slightly under a second, which is great considering this camera uses AA batteries; response time between pictures with the flash firing was around 2 seconds before ready to take another flash shot...a lot better than some other brands I've tried recently. (Specifically the Canon A495 and the Nikon L20, which I tried and eventually returned for a refund.  This Fuji AX200 leaves these two cameras behind in the dust.)A minor complaint I have with the AX200 is the shiny black plastic it is made of - it shows every fingerprint.  It looks nice but I wish they would make these cameras with a matte black finish instead.  The tripod mount is plastic also and is located in the center bottom, which is good for stability if using a mini-tripod.The optical wide angle zoom on this camera is 5X (a majority of cameras at this price point have 3X).  It uses readily-available AA batteries.  The camera comes with 2 alkaline batteries; I was able to shoot around 125 pictures and some short movies with these batteries before they expired.  I recommend buying rechargeable batteries; I got double the amount of shots with rechargeables.  You also need an SD card, this camera has some internal memory, but not enough to do anything other than take a few pictures.This camera is so easy to use, anyone from a young child to older people should have no trouble.  I handed it off to my 5 year old nephew to use and even he could figure out how to take a picture.  It's larger than an ultra-compact, and easier to hold onto.  The measurements are 3.7" wide x 2.4" high x 1.1" thick.  It's thicker on the end where the batteries and SD card are inserted.You can take the camera out of the box and be taking pictures in no time flat.  SR-Auto (the default) automatically senses the scene and adjusts itself accordingly:  Portrait, Landscape, Night, Macro, Backlit Portrait, or Night Portrait.There is no dial to change settings, everything is accessed thorough menu navigation.  It's easy to select the right shooting mode as there is a full description on the screen as you scroll through the settings.  For example:  on the Portrait Scene, the description underneath says "Portrait with soft overall tone and beautiful skin tones".In additional to having Face Detection, this camera has the following Scenes to choose from: Scene Recognition (SR Auto), Auto, P Program AE - where you can change ISO (100 to 3200), white balance and exposure.  Natural - no flash - and flash - takes 2 pictures, 1 with flash, 1 without.  Natural Light, Portrait, Baby Mode, Landscape, Panorama, Sport (I use this with pets that don't want to hold still).  Night, Night with Tripod, Fireworks, Sunset, Snow, Beach, Party, Flower, and Text.This camera has Picture Stabilization (somehow built into the camera's software), but it is NOT optical image stabilization.Next, you have your movie modes - 3 to choose from - HD at 720p, and also 640 and 320 in the AVI format.This is IMPORTANT: You can use the optical zoom while recording movies, however, sounds will not be recorded AT ALL during the ENTIRE time the lens is zoomed out......But if you leave the movie zoom setting on digital, not optical, you will record sound the entire time it is on digital zoom.  **This is a major complaint of mine for this camera.**  I did keep my rating at 5 stars, though, mainly because I won't be using zoom that often on my movies, and the digital zoom isn't as bad "quality-wise" as I thought it would be.If you want to play the movies back on your TV, you will need to purchase an additional A/V cable (AV-C1) if you don't already own one.  If you want to play an HD movie back on your HDTV, you will need to purchase an additional HDMI cable.  There is also an optional Model HDP-L1 player available on Fujifilm's web site, which includes an HD card reader and a remote.  Since I don't have an HDTV myself, I didn't purchase this so I can't comment on it.The AX200 also comes with very basic Fuji MyFinepixViewer photo editing software.  It's compatible with Windows 7, Vista, XP and Mac.  This is one area where Fuji lags behind the rest; I wish they could come up with software as good as the Canon ZoomBrowser.  The Finepix software was finally upgraded from the 2003 version with this camera, but it still doesn't impress me.  Using XP requires a minimum 512 RAM and Vista requires a minimum of 1 GB RAM.  Just download Picasa, it's better - and a free download.

Reviews.Title: Great Spec for a camera in this price range! But you get what you paid for...
Reviews.Author: C. Chiu
Reviews.Content: I decided to get a new camera after I realized how bulky my Canon A40 has become. I started to research as my primary concern about the new camera will have to have 5x optical, minimum 28mm wide angle, and uses AA battery. This camera was a dream come true: with all of the above features, plus all the extras.When I first received this camera, I was amazed how small it is even though it uses AA battery. The body feels quite plastic-ish but sturdy, as long as you don't drop it, it shouldn't break that easily. The grip is comfortable for one hand operation, but my hand is smaller than average, so for those with larger hands, you might want to get a feel of the camera before ordering. The silver edition does not seem to have the finger print smudge issue as of the black edition.I received the camera and start to take random photos. I realized the supposedly best feature of this camera SR AUTO is causing the lens to constantly making a buzzing noise. I guess that's ok when you are out door, but can be annoying when you are in a class, or quiet environment. All the photos turn out ok on the camera LCD. I also played with the zoom and settings. The menus are really simple and easy to navigate. The thumbnail viewing function is the best I've seen.After I loaded the photos into the PC, I found a major issue with this camera, which is supposedly its best feature - wide angle lens. I notice severe bending on the edge of the images. It's not as obvious in a scenery view, but you can still see that. However, for MACRO shots, you will feel like you are using a fish eye lens.The sharpness of the image is average, not the best, but not the worst either. The main quality problem with this camera is the ISO, once you pass 800, the noise level is unbearable. However, if you use the SR AUTO, you cannot adjust ISO (hopefully there will be firmware update fixing this). Thus, I recommend users to manually set ISO when in low light; when you are out door or with abundant lighting, then use the SR AUTO to fully utilize this camera.The video recording is great! Remember to use Class 6 or above speed if you like to make mini HD movies, else the camera will be really slow. The video quality is fantastic for a camera this price range.After all, I returned this camera as I did not like the fish eye effect, also the ISO noise level. But this doesn't mean this camera is bad, you are definitely getting whole lot features with this price for such a small camera. If you want a cheap HD video recorder, not taking close up shots, and always in places with enough lighting, I would definitely recommend this camera.PRO:- Pocket sized- AA battery powered- Wide angle lens- SR AUTO mode- Great photo viewing function- FANTASTIC HD video recording- The only camera with AA + wide angle lens in this size- REALLY inexpensiveCONS:- Plastic body- Image are bent on the side due to the wide angle, creates a "fish eye" effect- Cannot adjust ISO in SR AUTO- Buzzing noise when using SR AUTO

Reviews.Title: Versatile camera, great pix for the price
Reviews.Author: Jesse S
Reviews.Content: 10/27/10 Update: When you buy an SD memory card, MAKE SURE THAT IT IS CLASS 4 OR HIGHER. Lower class (lower read/write speed) cards will cause the camera to freeze when taking HD video. I just experienced this problem with a lower class card and see from reading other reviews that other people are having the same problem, not realizing you MUST HAVE CLASS 4 or higher memory in order to shoot HD video. I also see from the Amazon page that "other people frequently bought" a 4 GB SanDisk Class 2 card along with this camera. That Class 2 card WILL NOT support HD video, according to the Fuji manual. I have ordered a Class 4 card and will report back when it arrives.10/28/10 Update: Kingston 4 GB Class 4 SD card arrived today. I tried taking HD video clips outdoors this afternoon, and later this evening indoors. In the outdoor test, in bright afternoon conditions, using alkaline batteries, I took a total of 21 short HD videos. Of the first 10 videos, 2 caused the camera to freeze while it was shooting. Of the last 11 videos, 7 caused a freeze. Pretty bad, right? Well...this evening after dinner, I tried again, this time indoors. I took 16 more short HD videos in low indoor night light conditions, and NONE of them froze. Using the same alkaline batteries as before. No freezing. I tried switching to NiMH batteries...no freezing. I tried running the alkaline batteries until the camera shut down...no freezing. It's working perfectly now. Go figure...  *****end of update*****I read all the other Amazon reviews for this camera, and read the specs on the Fuji website before buying the camera. After using it for a day, I'm pleased to say that it has exceeded my expectations.The menus are well laid out, and the modes and settings are very easy to change. I've read the manual fairly carefully and have experimented a good deal with some of the "shooting modes" and have the following suggestions and observations for those (few) who have complained of poor picture quality. (I've gotten outstanding results so far).First, be aware that this camera has a WIDE ANGLE lens, which means that it's designed to capture a wider field of view than a "normal" 35 mm equivalent lens. This makes it good for close quarters (e.g. indoor photography where you're trying to get as much of a room as possible, or as many people as possible, into the frame). I just spent this afternoon photographing the interior of a small 17th century post-and-beam house, and the wide angle lens captured more of the interior than a 35 mm equivalent lens would have. The downside of the wide angle lens is that you will see some "fisheye" bending at the edges of the frame, but the bending does disappear as you zoom out to a longer focal length. The wide angle also means that, even with full zoom, subjects will appear farther away than with a "normal" zoom lens. So if you want maximum zoom magnification of distant objects, a wide angle lens probably isn't your best choice. On the other hand, if you want maximum field of view for nearby scenes and people, wide angle is the way to go. (This lens can also do "macro" closeups, but I haven't tried that yet).Second, it helps if you read up on ISO settings and understand that some unavoidable digital "noise" creeps into digital photos at higher ISO settings. The higher the ISO setting, the more unwanted "noise" you're going to get. Therefore, you get the best quality shots at the lowest ISO setting (100 for this camera). Read the manual and learn how to either set the ISO manually to 100 (in shooting mode "Program AE") and/or use the other modes in such a way as to induce it to choose the lowest ISO possible. This camera seems to have very low noise at ISO 100, some at ISO 400, and is marginal at ISO 800. Try to avoid ISOs above 400.Third, change the "Image Quality" setting from Normal to Fine. The camera comes set to Normal, which means that your photos will be digitally compressed to save storage space. However, the compression process loses some image quality. To get the best image quality, change to Fine, which will save photos without compression and thus give the best image quality. If you want more storage space and don't care so much about image quality, you can change back to Normal.Fourth, read the manual and experiment with the different shooting modes, which make this camera quite versatile. I just shot the interior of the historic house I mentioned above using a tripod and the "Night (Tripod)" shooting mode, and the photos came out great even though there was little interior light and I chose not to use a flash. The Night (Tripod) mode gives up to 4 seconds of shutter open time for very low light conditions, at low ISO settings (like 100) for great quality shots.Fifth, experiment with the "White Balance" adjustment in shooting mode "Program AE". White balance can make a big difference in the color of your shots.Sixth, learn how to read the info shown on the screen as you set up for a shot. The shooting mode, ISO, image quality (Normal or Fine), White Balance, and flash status are all shown on the screen and are important things to be aware of. Depress the shutter button half way and see the shutter speed and f-stop displayed in the lower left corner. If the ISO and shutter speed aren't going to be satisfactory, make the needed adjustments to the shooting program or flash before taking the shot. Also learn how the auto focus works, how it signals that the auto focus has locked in(beep and steady green light) and how the red AF! indicator means that the camera is unable to auto focus, due to low light or some other condition. No focus=blurry photo.Seventh, avoid the "SR Auto" mode. All it does is choose one of the other shooting modes automatically, which you should be able to do for yourself based on what/where you're shooting. According to the manual, the "SR Auto" mode is apparently a battery hog, because the manual recommends that, if your batteries are draining too quickly, you not use the SR Auto mode. And some of the other reviews here have complained about buzzing noises in the SR Auto mode (though I haven't experienced it). Don't bother using SR Auto. Problem solved.In short, this camera gives you a lot of ways to take great pictures, but it can't do its best work until you help it out by setting it up right and learning how to understand what it's telling you. If you take the time to follow the above steps you'll be shooting great photos in one day. (And, to be fair, other reviewers have reported good results right out of the box without bothering to read the manual. Just saying...if you're getting bad results, don't blame the camera...unless it's obviously broken.)

Reviews.Title: Great Quality And Overall Camera For Its Price
Reviews.Author: Celina J. Kilburger "Desert Rose"
Reviews.Content: I Have A Low Budget For This Kind Of Thing But I Really Wanted A Camera For Myself. So With My Set Budget I Looked Around At Cameras, Prices, & Features. I Was Getting Disheartened, But I Then I Saw The Fujifilm FinePix AX200. The Description Of The Camera Seemed Great For Its Price, So I Preordered The Camera.The Overall Camera Is Great. The Biggest Letdown Is The Battery Life. This Camera Sucks The Life Out Of Batteries. I Like To Use Rechargeable Batteries, If Not At Least Recycle The Others When They Die. Camera Also Comes With Some Great Settings, Features, & Modes:Image Size - From 2m - 12mImage Quality - Fine Or Normal3200 ISOExp. Compensation - Auto Or Manually SetWhite Balance - Auto Or Manually SetContinuous Mode - Up To 3 Pictures. Shot Up To 3 Consecutive PicturesIntelligent Face DetectionRed Eye RemovalScene Recognition Auto - Automatically Detects Scene Type & Scene Conditions And Sets Camera's Focus, Exposure, & White Balance AccordinglyProgram AE Shooting Mode - Automatic Mode With Programmed Setting. Set Your Own Exposure, White Balance, Features, etcMovie Shooting Mode - Movie Recoding With Sound. 720p HD Movies With Still Shots In 16:9Natural & Flash Shooting Mode - 2 Images Shot Continuously Without Flash And With FlashNatural Light Shooting Mode - Retains Natural Ambience Without FlashPortrait Shooting Mode - Portrait With Soft Overall Tone And Beautiful Skin TonesBaby Mode Shooting Mode - Suitable For Babies, For Natural Skin Tone Without FlashLandscape Shooting Mode - Clear Scenic ShotsPanorama Shooting Mode - Panorama Pictures By Consecutive 3 Shots Or Less. Put 2 Or 3 Pictures Together To Create 1 Image. Example: Landscape With A Structure Focus Point Is Too Wide For A Single Shot. Select The Panorama Mode - You Can Choose 2 Or 3 Shots To Later Stitch Together. You Select 3. (Panorama Mode Works Best With A Tripod, In This Example You Have One.) You Set The Tripod At The Far Left Of The Scene. The 1/3 Of Your Shot Is Taken Here. Like It, Keep It. The Camera Will Show The Cutoff Of Your Shot So You Can Line It Up For The 2nd Shot To Make The Panoramic Shot In The End Match Up And Look Great. Just Repeat What You Did In The 1st Shot For The 2nd & 3rd Shots. The Images Will Then Be Lined Up And Put Together To Create A Single ImageSport Shooting Mode - Suitable For Shooting A Moving SubjectNight Shooting Mode - Reduces Camera Shake With High ISO Setting For Night SceneryNight (Tripod) Shooting Mode - Clear Shots Of Night Scenery With A Slow Shutter SpeedFireworks Shooting Mode - Vivid Shots Of Fireworks With A Slow Shutter SpeedSunset Shooting Mode - For Shooting Sunsets, Making Colors More VividSnow Shooting Mode - Suitable For Shooting In Snowy ScenesBeach Shooting Mode - Crisp, Clear Shots When Shooting On The BeachParty Shooting Mode - Suitable For Shooting Indoor EventsFlower Shooting Mode - Effective For Taking More Vivid Shots Of FlowersText Shooting Mode - Effective For Taking Clearer Shots Of LetteringSilent Mode - Turns Of Flash And Turns Down Volume Of Camera For Places That Require Non-DisturbanceMacro Mode - For Shots Of Up-Close ImagesPicture Stabilization: Reduces Blur Caused By Such Things As Shaking Hands By Combining Higher Light Sensitivities And With Faster Shutter Speeds To Stabilize PicturesPicture Time Delay - Delay Pictures By 2 Or 10 Seconds. Delaying By 2 Seconds You Can Have More Time To Reduce Blur Or Get Your Shot In Focus. If You Have A Tripod, You Can Delay Your Picture For 10 Seconds, Allowing You Time To Get In The ShotPicture Search - Search For Your Pictures By Scene Mode, Look At 1 Picture At A Time On The Screen Or Choose To Look At 20 Pictures Or As Many As You Want Or Have. Looking At A Picture - When Looking At A Picture You Can Zoom In, A Small Box With The Whole Picture Will Show Up On The Side. That Small Box Will Have A Small Square In It Showing Where On That Whole Picture Your're Zooming In On.Zoom - 5x Wide Angle Optical ZoomLCD Crystal ScreenThere Are A Lot Of Great Things About This Camera. I Think It's Made Pretty Well. I Accidently Dropped A Heavy Battery Right On The LCD Screen. Thought I Broke It. I'm Clumsy...But The Camera Remained Unharmed And The Screen Was Still In Perfect Condition. It's Built Great And The Images Come Out Great As Well. I Definitely Recommend It.A Couple Of Cons:Battery Life - Like I Said Above, Sucks The Battery Life Right Out Of The Battery. I Suggest Rechargeable Batteries, You Won't Have To Buy New Ones For A Little While. The Camera Comes With A `Discharge' Feature That Drains The Rechargeable Batteries Life Out When You're Done Using The Camera . This Saves The Batteries Overall Life Span. Draining A Rechargeable Battery Completely And Then Recharging Them Makes Them Last Longer.Sound - The Camera Makes A Lot Of Sound. It's Noisy When On The SR (Scene Recognition) Mode. The Sound Comes From It Constantly Scanning What's In Its View And Adjusting The White Balance, Selecting A Mode, Etc. But I've Gotten Used To It When I Want To Use The SR. If You Don't Want The Noise, Just Choose The Program Shooting Mode Or One That Fits The Environment Your In.Besides That Other Things Are Minor. Depending On What Type Of Memory Card You Choose, Movies Can Last Up To Around 28min. I Have A Fujifilm SDHC 8GB Class 6 Memory Card. I Recommend It.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam for $100
Reviews.Author: M. Liu
Reviews.Content: Got delivered in 7 days, nicely packaged with two AA batteries, manual + CD and cord to plug into computer.I bought an 8GB sandisk memory card and rechargeable batteries with it.I was very pleased with the design of the cam and the nice 5x zoom with decent quality.The functions are very easy to learn and get used to, my only hassle is that i have to select for the video option and its not just a switch of one button b/w video and pic... (more like 3 buttons and it really matters when i wanna switch quickly b/w the two to take a pic or opt for a video!)My major concerns: when sound is off, the flash and self timer is off as well...WHen i was recording a video in HD for 60seconds+ and i pressed stop to save, it spazzed out and froze, after a minute it self shutdown and when i start it again, there was an error message for the video. This happened TWICE out of the ten times that i was recording, i have no idea what happened.BTW: the two AA batteries lasted me ~6 hours (total ~200 pictures + 3 vids), battery life depends on how often you use the cam but this is just an estimate if it helps..Lots of shooting modes: Scene recognition, auto, programmed, movie, natural light, portrait, baby mode, landscape, panorama, sport, night, fireworks, sunset, snow, beach, party flower, and text.Overall it takes great pics and HD videos (its only $100 too!)

Reviews.Title: Best camera for $100
Reviews.Author: Katmandu
Reviews.Content: A real pearl. Does everything you need and more for a point-and-shoot camera. Good quality on build and pictures. Ease of operation, multi-language and short times to write and shoot. Bought two of them.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon D90 with Nikon 18-200mm lens. But at times I don't want to carry all that weight for taking pics when quality really does not matter. I was thinking about Canon S90 (which is probably the best point & shoot camera), but the $400 price tag was a setback. Anyways I decided to give Fujifilm FinePix AX200 a try. the picture quality is pretty good along with ease of handling. it is little bigger than most P & S cameras out there because of the AA batteries. So when I'm out of town I down have to carry a charger all the time. AA batteries are easily available everywhere. that was one factor I considered buying this. you will not be disappointed. it takes pretty good pictures and video. what the heck, it only cost around 100 bucks and Fuji makes good stuff. If you don't want something expensive give this one a try as a side kick for quick pics.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Little Camera
Reviews.Author: BradlyC
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera online and am Impressed.  I've been using a Sony 4mp for years. Back when I bought it, I poured-over all the online reviews. Soooooo many models to choose from!  The little Sony had the best blend of price, image quality, build, and speed.  It still works great!But I wanted something with more resolution, and a little smaller.  I also wanted a longer zoom and a larger LCD.  One other important feature was that my new camera must operate on AA batteries.  This last need really narrowed the field.  Not many AA cameras out there anymore these days.  I looked at 'em all. And read all of the reviews.  I spent sooo much time at it that i got in trouble with the wife.  I hands-on tested and read about the Nikon F20 & 22, Lumix LZ10 & LZ 8's (couple years old, hard to find new,) Kodaks, GE's and Canons a 1100, SX120 & 130, a 490 & 495.)I ended up buying a Canon A2000. It was a couple of model years old, but was reviewed very well. 6x zoom, 3 inch lcd, 10mp, & optical stabilization.  It takes very nice pics, but it is too big, and the zoom is a little clunky.  It doesn't have a very wide lens.  It also has a long pic-to-pic lag.  When the flash is on, it's way-annoying.  Still, a nice camera.So, I saw the Fuji on clearance.  I had to have it. I feel that with a little work and practice, the fuji is better.  The canon is just too big to comfortably throw in a pocket and it looks way-dated. But the fuji is small, sleek, and can take great shotsI really like the AA power.  You can buy batteries anywhere.  I'm always the guy shooting at parties and trips long after everyone elses batteries are toast. The wide angle lens is nice (much wider than the canon's  28 vs 36), and if you don't need wide angle, just zoom a bit. Get closer and narrow the field.  The zoom operates smoothly and quickly. (I actually got the AX 230.  It's the same as the 200 but has a 3 inch big bright 3 inch lcd.) The batteries seemed to last longer in the Fuji, over my sony or canon. And it's significantly smaller than either.  Pockets comfortably. If you see a photo opp at a party, but you've got to run get your camera off the counter, or outa the wifes purse, what's the point?As one online reviewer indicated, you need to coach this camera to take great shots. Sure, you can start snapping away on Auto, and get some decent pics. But you can get some stunning shots if you understand the settings a little more and use them.First and foremost, especially with indoor shots, I would highly recommend that you do not enable the digital image stabilization.  This feature simply cranks iso to 800 or 1600 for low-light shots, in order to combat shakey hands.  Pictures come out with tons of noise=grainy, pixelated=lame.  When this feature is off, low-light indoor shots (without flash) are taken at ISO 400, and are much better.  Another option that works well is to turn on the flash, and shoot indoors with flash.Outside, my pics come out clear as a bell.  As the other reviewer indicated, you should also avoid the SR Auto mode.  My pics turn out better with plain-old Auto. If you want to frame a single person, inside or out, the wide angle lens often requires that you either A)Get close to your subject or B) you use the zoom a bit, as it's intended.Oh yeah, the 720 video is awesome.  Better than my Sony hard-drive handy-cam.Bottome line= Great camera. Do as I indicate above with the camera settings. Keep your elbows in, close to your body (keeps the camera steady) and snap away.  I got this little cam for less than $50 on clearance.  It is sweet and hope it lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: It's great! It's a camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Jaime "Self Icon"
Reviews.Content: People keep complaining for some reason like if they're mad that it doesn't do more. What do you all want, for it to make you breakfast? It's a camera!It does everything it says it does! I've heard a lot of people complain about the bending of the picture on the corners but i have not seen anything like it. I've had it for over a week but yet to see that. Also, about the noise it makes adjusting to take a picture in SR mode. Some people are just nitpickers!!! it's not overly loud or take forever to adjust at all. People just need to relax with their observations. They make it seem like it's a huge booming sound that's intolerable or something. I'ts not even loud. It's just adjusting anyway!! They tend to get too critical without realizing this: it's a under 100 dollar camera, be happy it takes pictures, if you don't want to wait 2 seconds for it to take a picture.....BUY SOMETHING ELSE. Go buy a 400 dollar camera. I bet you'll still find another inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures, Terrible Power Management
Reviews.Author: cspan37421
Reviews.Content: I've long been a fan of rechargeable AAs, perhaps because I usually try to avoid the steep pricing of proprietary rechargeable batteries. I also worry that a replacement lithium ion battery won't be available in the future, as the sizes aren't standardized and the technology changes so quickly - seems like a good device will be abandoned and obsolete after the 2-3 year battery dies.My experience with this camera is changing my view. This camera dies all the time because it thinks nearly-fully charged rechargeable batteries are dead. A simple example will suffice: Take 4 NiMH AAs that my superzoom Olympus camera thinks are at 100%. Regular NiMH or low self discharge, new  - does not matter. Take any two and put them in this AX200. It will die. Put them back in the Olympus (SP-565UZ), it works fine - and for a long, long time. I've had Eneloops in there for months that the AX200 won't even wake up for.I sent the camera back to Fuji with what I view as a fairly compelling story. They finally get back to me ... with an impersonal, somewhat inaccurate (they claim I also complained about noise ... I didn't), dot-matrix printed reply in telegram style, and say they can find nothing wrong. I'm no longer much of a Fuji fan (I had been based on the 3mp A210 I had for years).The pictures are sharp and the HD video is very, very nice. That's why 2 stars. The scene recognition mode does produce constant adjustment noises from the camera (I did not complain about them when I sent the AX200 back for power issues; I did once call to inquire whether it was normal, and they said it was). The screen is vivid and sharp, the form factor excellent. Would be nice to have a viewfinder, but it does pretty well anyway.All that said, the camera is just not reliable in terms of power. If you take freshly charged AAs straight out of the charger and into the camera, and use the thing continually with no flash, you might do OK. But if they were charged a week ago, and if you had a couple of quick uses in the meantime, they're going to be dead the third time you turn it on. Again, it's NOT because the NiMH are self-discharging that quickly. They'll power a bigger camera just fine. It's THIS camera that is the problem. I can't help but suspect that this camera draws 90% of what my 4-AA superzoom draws, and it can't deal with it on just 2 AAs. That's a guess - I don't know. But because it is not ready to go, most of the time, it's going to get replaced with a non-Fuji, non-AA model.[Edit 10/26/2010: see comments below; it's possible Fuji failed to point out to me a setting that may explain the problems above. I will test this and see if it makes a difference. I would LOVE for it to work well with rechargeables, though I don't think my wife cares. She just wants it to be ready to use whenever she needs it]

Reviews.Title: Fugi Camera
Reviews.Author: Luna L.
Reviews.Content: I really Like this camera. very Good deal for the price. The pictures and settings are very nice, and it takes clear images and the natual light setting is very good.I have been using an 8GB card and it works very well with it. I have had it for over a year now. The only thing which I would say was not good is the volume on the videos. The videos themselves are good, the HD setting is exellent. But the volume is terrible. even with the settings on highest volume in the menu and in the video. you really need to put it on the computer to hear it properly, unless you're very loud!:) But I wouldn't let that get in your way of getting this camera. The pictures are good, the videos are good, and the battery lasts a good deal of time. All in all very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: At first I tought that this camera was not a very BIG thing but when I used it, just change my point of view about it. The pictures taken have very good resolution and the videos are actually in HD, just need a memory card with enough capability to storage of your images and videos. 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix
Reviews.Author: Mirmaze
Reviews.Content: Camera looks and feels good.  Would have liked it to have a black and white color mode or maybe some other color mode settings.  Some of the presets make the pictures look really grainy. If you can get the right setting and allow the camera to focus then the pictures are really good.  For the price it's a good camera that takes decent photos.

Reviews.Title: great camera for price. best in sunny light
Reviews.Author: R. halford
Reviews.Content: good camera for point and shoots. most pics come out good. best for full sun or bright light. video tends to freeze up when shooting hd. easy to use. great price. use sanyo rechargeable batteries and it will go all day.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kiri
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera two years ago and it has served me really well. In full daylight settings it takes really great and clear photos, however in low light the pictures come out very grainy, unless you have a tripod and do full exposure, in which case they're extremely clear.The size of the camera makes it very easily portable. I definitely recommend getting a case for it because if you get dirt in the lens it dies. (Just happened to mine unfortunately)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: C. B.
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I was looking for a simple point and shoot camera which uses AA batteries and has wide angle. This camera has both. I was surprised at the clarity of pictures. I particularly like the wide angle capability of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Lovell K. Henson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace one a lot like it that I lost.  I have had 6 Fuji cameras since my first one in 1998.  This one is no exception, it does what it is supposed to do, take great pictures, quickly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: Okay for price
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this little P&S; camera because I needed something small that I could stick in my purse for times when I did not want to carry around my larger Nikon DSLR.  It was recommended by the camera sales person so I thought I would give it a shot.  I have been a little disappointed at the auto-focus finder.  It very frequently is out of focus and takes forever in between pictures.  It is pretty good in outdoor bright light type settings, but definitely not indoors!  The flash isn't so great wither.  All in all, I guess I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: Nice video but noisy pictures!
Reviews.Author: Teri West
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good video although the sound is not always great.  I video alot of music being played live.  The sound quality is probably 3 out of 5 stars.  The videos are very clear but the pictures are usually too noisy if you are using it in poor lighting, situations where the there is light, but not enough.  The flash function will only cover maybe 8 -10', depending on the light.  I have alot of hand motion and I have to use a tripod but even with the tripod, the shots are not as focused as I would like.  I am not a professional photographer and I may be doing things wrong, but as far as auto mode, point and shoot, I probably need to learn more about things like ISO and white exposure, etc....  although, for the price, it is a jewel as far as video goes for a beginner!

Reviews.Title: Fujji Fine Pix AX200
Reviews.Author: albert6500
Reviews.Content: An outstanding value, the camera is packed with great features usually found in more expensive models.  Very easy to use and takes great pictures. The only drawback I have found is a seemingly short battery life even with the NIMH recharge ables.  On the upside though the batteries are AA allowing easy access to purchase if necessary.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot with AA batteries.
Reviews.Author: A. Trofimov
Reviews.Content: I wanted a point and shoot that runs on AA batteries and I had to get it under 100 bucks and this was the best choice. I'm very pleased. It's got great zoom, good sensitivity, and my favorite thing is the natural shooting mode where it takes 2 pictures every time you press the shoot button. It takes one with flash and one without. No more hassle to see if flash is better or necessary.So far I've shot 400 photos (so 200 flashes) and the battery is still alive.Overall if you combine it with 5x zoom it's a good camera. The only downside is that it's got a wide lens. It's excellent for taking landscape photos. I was in a small room and wanted to fit 11 people in one one shot. Their point and shoot cameras couldn't fit us all, but mine could. The downside is that taking a photo of my face makes it look weird. It's distorted, so no MySpace-style shots with this one.

Reviews.Title: Entering into a different world
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for someone else who had been using an old 35 MM film camera and hadn't yet experienced the difference of a digital camera. This particular camera has many quality features that make it possible for the user to take much better pictures without being extremely knowledgeable about cameras. In fact, I recommended this same camera to someone else who bought it and both are extemely pleased with the camera and it's performance.  I made an excellent purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, plenty of features
Reviews.Author: Luis Mederos "lmederos"
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought to replace a broken one on a quick basis.  Overall, the features are very nice, many of which I did not have before, e.g., stitched panorama shots; HD video.  And for less than $100.  It is small and easy to carry.Cons:1.  battery status needs improvement:  batter shows as near fully drained and then returns to near fully charged2.  navigation is somewhat cumbersome: multiple buttons to work with at timesPicture quality is good; Fuji makes great lenses in general.For an under $100 point and shoot, this is a good camera, but it is less than perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fijifilm AX200, not what expected.
Reviews.Author: mr.kennedy0
Reviews.Content: The quality of pictures is not what I expected. ISO has to be very low for pictures to have a good quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: frugal shopper
Reviews.Content: I researched cameras extensively before buying, in my opinion, this is the best camera for the price currently on the market. I read the full length manual available on Fujifilm's website, it is a lot of reading, but will help you take better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good point-and-shoot pics, good HD movies and terrific price
Reviews.Author: Steven Lee "leebobo"
Reviews.Content: I needed another digital camera as a spare.  This model has everything I wanted in a very attractive price.  First, it runs on 2 AA battery.  I travel out of the country often and I don't want to carry any universal chargers with me.  1 set of AA battery can last me 2+ weeks.  Secondly, it has HD quality video.  I own a Samsung and I think it has a bit better video quality than the Fuji.  In lower lighting situations, I see a lot of video "noises" in the video.  But, 720p is still better than standard VGA so I am happy with the quality.  I bought this as a point-and-shoot camera so picture quality is good enough for me.  I got this from Electronics-expo thru Amazon.  Shipping was fast and great after-sales services.  I received notification and tracking e-mails from the seller so I know exactly when I can expect my package. After I received the camera, I noticed the camera makes a "buzzing" noise all the time.  At first, I thought it was a defective camera.  So, I use seller's live-chat system to see if I can resolve this problem.  I chatted with one of their help-support person and his name is Rich H.  He was extremely helpful and gave me everything I needed to trouble shoot the problem.  In the end, it turns out that the noise is caused by the auto-focus system (see my cons section).Pros:Price, 720p video, runs on AACons:Auto-focus noise.Few mechanical dials and mostly all functions are all controlled by electronic menu system.  Not bad if you know how to use it.  Unlike some other brands, you can easily change shooting mode (picture to video) by turning a rotary dial.  Again, once you got used to the menu system, you can do it quickly.Note:1) I have the same issue with other reviewers regarding the use of the "Silent mode".  This mode is used when you don't wish to "disturb" the subject.  By design, I think, the camera turns off the flash.  As for me, I like to shut off all unnecessary noises from the camera.  To do that, I go to Set-up > Operation Vol and Shutter Volume.2) Set Up -> Movie Zoom Type.  I set it to zoom by "optical" instead of the default "digital" setting3) Set Up -> Battery Type.  Not sure the difference between Alkaline and Ni-mh but since I use rechargeable only, I set it to Ni-mh.

Reviews.Title: Pure GARBAGE
Reviews.Author: Twashy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and could not be more disappointed.The picture quality is horrible, it seemed like every picture was blurry and out of focus.  The battery life is terrible too.  Even running on 2 eneloop rechargables, they would die in less than a day. On store bought batteries it wouldn't even last that long.I DO NOT recommend buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: A Great little Camera.
Reviews.Author: HazyShades
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features of much more expensive models. It was priced just right and my wife loves it.

Reviews.Title: Good but
Reviews.Author: Big Al
Reviews.Content: Hard to see LCD when out in sun.  Would be great if you could see thru a lense view.  Dose take nice clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: The Fuji ax cameras are nice little cameras.  This one is an old model that I got used at a super low price so it is fine for a back up camera.  It takes panorama pictures but they are not as easy as on the newer models.

Reviews.Title: Nice Item!
Reviews.Author: Dwayne Keith Mobley
Reviews.Content: this was my next step into the photo world, so this made my second camera and of course after this I brought the GE, from Amazon

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: yahschild60
Reviews.Content: Still using this years latter!Takes great pictures!!!Easy to use!I LOVE FUJI PRODUCTS!! THEY ARE MADE OF GREAT QUALITY!

Reviews.Title: Batteries problem
Reviews.Author: fadi karam
Reviews.Content: The camera consume the batteries very fastI had to change the batteries every two days , because of that I had to buy a rechargeable batteries and their chargerAnd keep charging them on almost daily bases

Reviews.Title: business
Reviews.Author: Natalie Mohammed
Reviews.Content: thank you very much it is good i can bye again from you when needed and sorry for responding so late and have a MERRY CHRISTMAS

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Donnie
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price. The LCD is not bright in sun light. Easy to operate. I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT USE
Reviews.Author: Margo
Reviews.Content: The WORST camera I've ever used. I recently broke my camera-- er my dog ate it. So I had to borrow my mother's camera when it was time to get picture of/with my favorite band. Every picture was terrible quality. And the personal pictures of me meeting the band? OF COURSE they are 'broken' files. I always read reviews before I buy something. So please take this into consideration. I've never been more upset at an inanimate object in my life.

Reviews.Title: must have if working
Reviews.Author: cherie
Reviews.Content: Nice Camera I gave a 4 because this one cut off after setup the replacement works perfect small compact and compact

Reviews.Title: So so
Reviews.Author: Ilya Gordon "small bird"
Reviews.Content: Power consumption unexpectedly high, batterys will not last. Has wide range of zoom, but otherwise  mediocre camera, may be because I really did not get used to it. Have better luck with other brands.

Reviews.Title: Worked well for a few months.
Reviews.Author: Newkem8
Reviews.Content: Camera worked great for a few months. After that it stopped working. Camera treated well. Just stopped working one day. I guess I got a lemon.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Juand
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much to the seller, the product is good, the relation cost/benefit is OK, this camera is good for beginners, it comes with batteries and it works with 2 x AA batteries, these batteries are not expensive and they are very easy to found in the market. the weight of the camera is OK for a hand camera.  The desing of the camera is beautiful.  The quality of the pictures is good.

Reviews.Title: it was a present
Reviews.Author: Kathy Smith
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my son age 31 he was surprised to get it.He has used it and is very pleased with it.This spring and summer the camera(Fuji fine pix AX100)will get a work out and we will be better able to comment on it.So far he is happy with it and pleased with all the gadgets on it and the apps .My son was a little specific on a point and shoot digital camera as he wanted a 5 X optical zoom and at least a 10 megapixal so I ahd to do some research and this seemed like the best camera for the price.Also it shipped quickly as did the other items I purchased for it.I also got an extended warranty for it with accidental coverage.Hope we never have to use it but bettersafe than sorry.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Maria Shaffer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my husband as a Christmas present. The camera has EXCELLENT picture clarity. The HD video is wonderful as well! I received the camera in great condition, and very timely, as well!The only reason I give it 4 stars is it has a plastic shell rather than a metal shell, although it is my own fault for not checking that particular quality.Other than that, great product!

Reviews.Title: Fuji AX 200 camera
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for travel. Takes AA batteries (no worries about foreign electric converters for charging batteries). AA batteries are avialable world wide. It's inexpensive and thereby no worries about breaking it or theft).Picture quality is fine and screen is acceptable. In addition, it's small and lite.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Laura V. Petrillo
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera yesterday! I used to have a fujifilm so it was real simple to figure out.  I love the quality of pictures that this takes.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a nice affordable camera! I only gave 4 stars for the battery because I have rechargeable batteries, so I'm not sure how long they last, yet.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm finpix camera
Reviews.Author: Judy Crowder "JC"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my nephew He just loves it he cant take enough pictures with it. He Is So Happy with this Camera

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Ax200
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a point and shoot cameragot interested in this fujifilm camera because of the price and i am impressed - it has the BEST value for the price.Also i'm really thankful for Amazon customer Service, the first shipment which i got had a malfunction and they have replaced it free of charge, so now i have a GREAT looking easy to use point and shoot camera which i am really satisfied with.

Reviews.Title: Fuji AX200 Camera
Reviews.Author: Rich D
Reviews.Content: The Fuji AX200 Camera is small, light weight, good looking and easy to use. The 5x optical zoom is a big plus. However, the very slow shutter speed (i.e., 1/3 to 1/2 second between button push and shutter operation) results in many missed shots, especially with moving targets. The camera has several 'shot types' that can be selected to optimize shutter speeds and flash type (e.g., landscape, night, close up, portrait, sports, etc.). Unfortuantly, only the landscape optimization is suitable for all-around shooting. Most of the other settings result in photos that are 'muddy', to dark and with limited contrast. This is a shame since the 12 MP images should provide for a greater depth of field than my old Fuji 2 MP digital -yet the old one takes better photos when color contrast is considered.All in all, I'm ok with the camera considering it only cost $5 after my $100 gift certificate that I received from a drawing.Fujifilm FinePix AX200 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Annoying buzz
Reviews.Author: RG "RG"
Reviews.Content: The new camera has an annoying buzz when on, as the lens mechanism is constantly changing the settings, and Fuji has not fixed it yet(!?)  The constant servo movements will lead to early failure of the lens servos, perhaps right after the warranty runs out.  Put your ear to the lens and check your camera for the noise.  I never heard a continuous noise like that in Lumix or Canon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Gabriel X. Lopez "G.A. López"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a week. So far so good. The only problem i found is the construction quality, it is too prone to finger prints. Otherwise i am very happy with this purchase. Pictures are nice, with good color and very sharp. HD video is excellent. Recomended.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Camera
Reviews.Author: Happy Man
Reviews.Content: Camera came in good condition in a reasonable amount of time and is serving me well.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Murali K. Siruvuru
Reviews.Content: Shutter speed is little slow & auto adjust takes a good amount of time. If not otherwise, its a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Barker
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little camera for under $100. It's compact and easy to use and exactly what I was looking for in a simple, point-and-shoot camera.I'm not a photography buff, I don't know the subtleties of lighting and such, so please don't rely on my review if you are. If you're a regular person who just wants a simple, good camera to take pictures with, you can't go wrong with this one.The only problem I have is the auto focus seems a little loud. Other than that, it's a lovely camera. Definite recommend!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Lover of English
Reviews.Content: I have been very disappointed with this camera.  I expected to get pictures at least as good as those from my 35mm camera.  I only take indoor shots and this Fuji camera takes a very small shot and leaves everything around it black.  When I use a flash the picture is too bright and looks cheap.  I should have sent it back.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the beginner photographer
Reviews.Author: William Daymon
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera for the price. It is small but powerful and a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Fuji digital camera
Reviews.Author: Geneva Teeters
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, takes quality photos.  Does use a lot of batteries if taking flash photos.

Reviews.Title: good value for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Dolsen "louie_d_"
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find a 12MP camera with 5x optical zoom in this price range.  Overall, I am pleased with the camera.  I like the feature that automatically switches modes based on the lighting conditions. The picture quality and battery life are as good as I need them to be.  My one complaint is that the shutter button may be going. I have to press it just right to get it to pre-focus otherwise it just snaps the picture.  This probably has more to do with the camera banging around in my backpack than to any design or quality defect though.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Dave Hall
Reviews.Content: Came a little late considering I paid for 1 day delivery....  But when I got it I was happy as it's a good camera and for the price, a real bargain :-)

Reviews.Title: Julian
Reviews.Author: Julian Guillen
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara me sorprendi con la calidad de las fotos y su facil uso, tengo otra fuji S700 y no me puedo quejar de la marca, la proxima es posible que tambien sea Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Jose Olivo Santos
Reviews.Content: I have problems with the camera, the buttons do not work normal, changes from one state to another if you try to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: focus
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Troyer
Reviews.Content: Though I like the features on this camera and the price, I had focus problems from the start and had to send it in for replacement or fix, and still find it does not want to focus as easily as my sons' Canon. Also the worst part is the program for downloading the camera images is nothing short of horrible. It is almost impossible to use. I would not recommend this camera for that alone.

Reviews.Title: Updated - Constant Freezing
Reviews.Author: C. Azima
Reviews.Content: So far this camera seems ok. I don't know if this is normal but the zoom and the focus are a lot louder than I ever heard in my previous point and shoots. There is a very loud and noticeable crackle when it tries to refocus itself; kind of makes me feel like the thing is broken. The HD video is nice but the microphone volume is very sensitive. I've already had the audio stop in the middle of a video after a large 'pop' sound. If it keeps up, I may exchange it out but this is still a good camera for 100 bucks.update, changed this to 4 stars as the pop and audio stopping issue has not happened again. Pictures continue to come out very nice with the camera. Crinkly, Crackly zoom and focus still remains though.-Update yet again. I constantly get freezing when shooting HD video. Other reviewers have found this problem too. The camera locks up and simply freezes. You have to remove the batteries and put them back in to get the camera working again and worst of all, your previous video progress is lost!!!!

Reviews.Title: Stops working in a few weeks
Reviews.Author: VK
Reviews.Content: After just a few weeks it stopped working (the lens won't retract back into the camera.) Unfortunately, that was a gift for a friend of mine in another country, and the Fuji's "international warranty" appeared to be just a fiction. So now they have to either send it back to me, or pay to get it fixed. My friend also mentioned that it made strange noises when zooming or focusing before it broke down. Bottom line: do not buy it. The price is not bad for a camera, but you can pay much less for a paperweight, and that's what it really is.

Reviews.Title: about to fall apart
Reviews.Author: dee's view
Reviews.Content: I should have heeded the warning about the noises in the camera.  The camera sounded like it was going to fall apart.  When recording a video there was a loud hum from the camera not the room noise. The images did not look crisp.  I had to return it. Thank you amazon for great return system.

Reviews.Title: Too early
Reviews.Author: Lawrence J. Landherr
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything it was supposed to do.  I have only had it for a month and haven't used it that much yet.  I will be traveling to the Grand Canyon in 3 weeks and then I will have had a better chance to evaluate it.

Reviews.Title: Was expecting more
Reviews.Author: Pipeman
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera for vacation, but didn't want to pay a big price. The reviews on this were good, so I opted for it instead of other brands. I own a larger Fuji, which I love- but it was too big and bulky for quick shots.This small camera is confusing. I still have problems with pressing the wrong buttons for preview and setup, and it's difficult to see the screen shot. i end up taking several shots, hoping that at least one will be good when I download to my computer.Some pics came out crystal clear.Others were blurry. I'm sure that was a fault on my part, but who has time to go in and change options when you are trying to catch a surprised look or a quick moment?If I had it to do over,I would shop around longer and take a better look at the operations of various cameras. For ease of use.A little disappointing, but hopefully not a total mistake when vacation gets here.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - BAD SOFTWARE
Reviews.Author: Anthony Delorenzo Jr.
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fuji AX200 after I read all the reviews and found that the camera had many features for the money. HOWEVER, the camera WILL NOT work with my Windows 7 HP computer. I've been in touch with Fuji's technical services and was told they are receiving many calls from buyers that the Fuji Finepix software isn't working with Windows 7 and they haven't yet resolved the issue. After an hour on the phone with Fuji technicians, I still can not get the computer to recognize the camera. If I ever get the software to work, I'll update the review.DO NOT purchase this camera if your computer is running Windows 7!!!This is not an Amazon issue, it's a Fuji issue that they haven't resolved.

Reviews.Title: It is not wat I was expecting...
Reviews.Author: Nancy Nunez Rivera
Reviews.Content: I just received my Fujifilm camera, but  I am not happy with the photographies that it takes, when I need to use the flash, the photographies are like blurry, also when I take pictures with the zoom, I did not expected this from a Fujifilm camera.  It is also making an extra noise when taking a picture from the lens.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't work !!!
Reviews.Author: Giorgi Sukhishvili
Reviews.Content: It doesn't work and I demand on sending new one. It has problems. I don't know if it damaged while shipping or it had problems beforehead but I paid for it and I want new one that works !
